sections.description: Custom Gutenberg blocks tailored for the 360 network. Includes hero layouts, CTA components, clinic listings, info cards, and PatientReach360 assessment integrations designed for healthcare organizations.
sections.installation:
1. Download the latest release ZIP from GitHub.
  2. Upload via Plugins → Add New → Upload Plugin.
  3. Activate and locate the blocks inside the "360 Blocks" category.
sections.changelog:
1.3.57

  • Added an editor-facing alt text field to the Two Column block, auto-prefilled from media metadata and rendered on the frontend so block imagery no longer ships empty alt attributes.
  • Updated the Video Two Column lite YouTube thumbnail to reuse the video title (or block heading) for its alt copy, keeping autoplay placeholders accessible.

1.3.56

  • Surface the first Global Blocks image directly inside Gutenberg so Yoast SEO sees that media during analysis, eliminating the recurring "No images appear on this page" warning for block-driven layouts.
  • Localize the collector output and dispatch setContentImage() in the yoast-seo/editor store only when Yoast and supported post types are present, keeping the bridge lightweight.

1.3.55

  • Added the Patient Reviews Slider block with header, background color selection, and responsive slider controls.
  • Added the One Column Video block with heading, YouTube link field, background color selection, and a centered 1140px layout.

1.3.54

  • Removed extra padding on .main-paragraph-con inside the Video Two Column body.

1.3.53

  • Added a None option to the Info Cards icon selector so cards can render without an icon.

1.3.52

  • Let the Comparison Table background color cover the full-width section while the heading, table, and footnote stay centered inside a 1140px inner wrapper for consistent alignment.
  • Synced the table header and body cell borders so every column shows subtle dividers and the highlighted header row keeps sentence-case typography instead of forcing row labels.
  • Removed the outer box shadow from the FAQ Accordion wrapper so it blends into tinted landing page bands while each accordion card retains its own elevation.

1.3.51

  • Introduced a Comparison Table block with selectable column and row counts so service-line pages can reuse the treatment matrix layout without manually coding tables.
  • Auto-paints the highlighted header row with the brand color stored in 360 settings (falling back to --cpt360-primary) while shipping responsive zebra-striping styles for both the editor and frontend.

1.3.50

  • Always enqueues the shared global-shared.min.css bundle so blog templates without questionnaire blocks still load the Page Title Hero width constraints.
  • Strengthened the shared `.sm_hero h1` rule with !important values to preserve the centered 1140px width and 1.4 line-height when themes inject their own heading styles.

1.3.49

  • Forced every Page Title Hero heading to inherit the centered 1140px max width even when themes apply their own `.sm_hero h1` rules.
  • Rebuilt the block so the editor preview and compiled frontend CSS keep the 1.4 line-height and `margin: 0 auto` consistently.

1.3.48

  • Centered the Page Title Hero heading inside a 1140px max width with margin auto so long service-line names stay aligned with the rest of the hero grid.
  • Reduced the hero H1 line-height to 1.4 and rebuilt the block assets so the refreshed typography matches in both the editor preview and the frontend.

1.3.47

  • Swapped the Video Two Column body field to InnerBlocks so bullets, numbered lists, and quotes can be added without leaving the block.
  • Migrates existing body text automatically and refreshes the frontend styles so paragraphs and lists share consistent spacing.

1.3.46

  • Added a palette-aware background color picker to the Video Two Column block so the full-width section can match branded surfaces without custom CSS.
  • Adjusted the editor UI, frontend CSS, and PHP render wrapper so the selected color blankets the entire block instead of only the content column.

1.3.45

  • Added the standard Media position toggle to the Video Two Column block so the video column can flip to either side without recreating the section.
  • Synced the editor preview, frontend CSS, and PHP render markup with the toggle so padding and grid order always follow the selected layout.

1.3.44

  • Kept the FAQ Accordion background full bleed while constraining the dropdown list to a centered 1140px width with 20px gutters.
  • Rebuilt the FAQ bundle so GitHub auto-updates ship the refreshed layout immediately.

1.3.43

  • Kept the FAQ Accordion answer editors visible and labeled in WordPress 6.9, removing deprecated RichText props that prevented the fields from being editable.
  • Loosened the question and answer spacing so multi-line copy reads comfortably on both the front end and inside the editor.

1.3.42

  • Introduced a FAQ Accordion block with reorderable RichText questions, answer fields, and palette-aware background plus open-state color controls.
  • Bundled a lightweight frontend script so only one dropdown stays open at a time while mirroring the smooth animation seen in the editor.

1.3.41

  • Added palette-integrated color controls to the Two Column block for both headings and backgrounds.
  • Ensured the frontend render mirrors those selections for a consistent preview.

1.3.40

  • Matched the Two Column CTA button styles and default copy to the PatientReach360 questionnaire button.
  • Removed the extra left padding on CTA headings and body text wrappers for clean alignment inside the grid.

1.3.39

  • Added the Two Column CTA block with an 800/300 split grid, InnerBlocks-powered content column, configurable button, and adjustable background color.

1.3.38

  • Standardized repository and folder naming to lowercase (360-global-blocks) to ensure consistent plugin paths across development and production environments.
  • Updated manifest URL and download links to point to the renamed GitHub repository.

1.3.37

  • Fixed a missing closing </div> tag in the Two Column Slider render function that was causing all subsequent page content to be incorrectly wrapped inside the slider container.

1.3.36

  • Forced the Two Column block to stack media above content on phones, even when the layout toggle pins imagery to the right column on desktop.
  • Kept the editor and frontend markup identical so the CSS-only layout flip preserves DOM order for better accessibility and predictable theming.

1.3.35

  • Added a media-position toggle to the Two Column block so you can flip the image to the right column without duplicating layouts.
  • Synchronized editor and frontend padding, including a dedicated 40px 80px 40px 30px spacing pass when the image is right-aligned.

1.3.34

  • Removed the remaining grid gap in the Two Column block so the media column can sit flush with the viewport edge on desktop.
  • Locked the desktop padding to 40px 30px 40px 80px and rebuilt the bundle so the text column now matches the Video Two Column block.

1.3.33

  • Eliminated leftover padding on legacy main-*-con wrappers so two-column body copy now lines up with its heading in both the editor and the front end.
  • Regenerated the two-column block assets to ship the refined spacing defaults with this release.

1.3.32

  • Bundled the Health Icons catalog directly into the Info Cards editor build so the full picker loads without enqueueing extra scripts.
  • Swapped the CTA heading for a RichText field so editors can update the hero message inline while keeping the frontend output sanitized.
  • Rebuilt affected block assets and bumped release metadata for the GitHub auto-updater.

1.3.31

  • Split every block into dedicated edit.js and lightweight view.js bundles so editor-only dependencies stay out of the frontend.
  • Refreshed the manifest-driven loader so WordPress only enqueues the new view builds when matching blocks render.
  • Retired the experimental health icon loader and tidied shared assets to keep the plugin lean.

1.3.30

  • Converted the Full Hero background from CSS to an eager <img> tag so browsers can surface the hero art as the page's Largest Contentful Paint, complete with width, height, and alt metadata.
  • Tuned the Full Hero typography across desktop, tablet, and mobile breakpoints so headings remain bold without overwhelming smaller screens.
  • Rebuilt the Full Hero bundle and refreshed block manifests to ensure WordPress registers the updated assets after deployment.

1.3.29

  • Added a shared global-shared.min.css bundle that automatically loads whenever a PatientReach360 questionnaire button renders, keeping assessments styled even on pages without the CTA block.
  • Recompiled block assets after moving the questionnaire button rules out of individual bundles, trimming duplicate CSS from the CTA, Full Hero, Two Column, and Video Two Column blocks.
  • Removed the unused legacy global360blocks/hero scaffold to eliminate inaccurate unsupported-block notices inside Gutenberg.

1.3.28

  • Converted the Video Two Column block to a lite YouTube embed so the full player loads only after interaction, trimming unused network requests on initial page load.
  • Added a global360blocks_video_two_column_use_lite_embed filter so site owners can opt back into the classic iframe renderer without modifying plugin files.

1.3.27

  • Introduced a manifest-driven asset loader so block CSS and scripts only load when their block renders, dramatically reducing unused frontend styles.
  • Added safeguards that always queue Latest Articles styling on blog/archive templates and preload hero bundles when detected above the fold to eliminate flashes of unstyled content.
  • Exposed filters for extending forced asset lists so custom templates can opt in without editing plugin code.

1.3.26

  • Forced the Video Two Column block to stack its controls vertically with inline flex fallbacks so cached admin CSS can no longer collapse the video URL input over the title.
  • Recompiled the block bundle and rescanned manifests to ship the layout guardrails with this release.

1.3.25

  • Polished trademark styling in the Full Hero block so ™/®/℠ render as compact superscripts on both the front end and inside the editor.
  • Refreshed block source styles to match Prettier formatting so diffs stay clean across future updates.

1.3.24

  • Added an optional video title field to the Video Two Column block so editors can reinforce messaging directly above each embed.
  • Render the new title as an <h2> and apply the shared heading font stack at 2.5rem/400 so typography stays consistent across the site.
  • Rebuilt the block assets to ship the updated markup and styling with this release.

1.3.23

  • Introduced a global --heading-letter-spacing variable that resolves to 0.5px only when the site loads the Anton heading font.
  • Updated every block stylesheet to consume the new variable and recompiled the build assets so frontend and editor stay in sync.
  • Ensured the inline CSS helper sets the same letter-spacing rules inside the editor wrapper for consistent previews.

1.3.22

  • Standardized typography across every block so headings and buttons now pull the theme's --heading-font, --body-font, and weight variables with a 400 fallback.
  • Recompiled all block bundles to ship the updated CSS alongside the source changes.
  • Confirmed manifests and render templates are recopied during builds so WordPress keeps registering each block after updates.

1.3.21

  • Streamlined the Two Column Slider on phones with tighter padding, reduced shadows, and responsive typography so the card height fits comfortably on small screens.
  • Automatically hides the companion slide image below tablet widths, keeping the focus on messaging while trimming excess vertical real estate.
  • Mirrored the mobile styling updates in the editor experience so authors preview the same stacked layout while editing.

1.3.20

  • Reworked the Popular Practices block so it never repeats random clinics and centers layouts gracefully when fewer than four cards are available.
  • Expanded clinic logo pads to 150px with matching image constraints for cleaner brand display across all column widths.
  • Ensured slider and popular practices block metadata stays bundled in build artifacts, preventing "unsupported block" warnings after future deployments.

1.3.19

  • Gave each Two Column Slider card its own background color picker so marketing teams can apply per-slide accents without custom CSS.
  • Capped hero-side imagery at 700px (desktop) to prevent tall uploads from stretching the layout while keeping the mobile stack flexible.
  • Updated the build pipeline to include the slider block metadata, preventing "unsupported block" warnings after future deployments.
